blocks.name: cprb
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the class of probability measures.
blocks.origin: const class cprb { Prob }

blocks.name: diff.cprb.s
diff.cprb.c
diff.cprb.w
df-prob
blocks.content: Define the class of probability measures as the set of measures with total measure 1. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 14-Sep-2016.)

blocks.name: elprob
blocks.content: The property of being a probability measure. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 8-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm elprob(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cprb), wa(wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cdm(c0))), nat1)))
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, cprb, cuni(crn(cmeas)), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cdm(c0))), nat1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(cv(hs0)))), nat1))
  eqeq1d(cfv(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(cv(hs0)))), nat1, cfv(c0, cuni(cdm(c0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq12d(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(cv(hs0))), c0, cuni(cdm(c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieqd(cdm(cv(hs0)), cdm(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  dmeq(cv(hs0), c0)
  df-prob(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(crn(cmeas)))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cdm(c0))), nat1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elprob(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Prob ↔(c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)∧(c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0))= 1))
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, cprb, ⋃ ran(measures), (c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0))= 1, (hs0 ` ⋃ dom(hs0))= 1)
  eqeq1d((hs0 ` ⋃ dom(hs0)), nat1, (c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0)), hs0 = c0)
  fveq12d(hs0, ⋃ dom(hs0), c0, ⋃ dom(c0), hs0 = c0)
  id(hs0 = c0)
  unieqd(dom(hs0), dom(c0), hs0 = c0)
  dmeq(hs0, c0)
  df-prob(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(⋃ ran(measures))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0))= 1)
}

blocks.name: domprobmeas
blocks.content: A probability measure is a measure on its domain. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: domprobsiga
blocks.content: The domain of a probability measure is a sigma-algebra. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: probtot
blocks.content: The probability of the universe set is 1. Second axiom of Kolmogorov. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 8-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: prob01
blocks.content: A probability is an element of [ 0 , 1 ]. First axiom of Kolmogorov. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.pretty:
thm prob01(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0))→(c0 ` c1)∈(0[[,]]1))
} = {
  sylibr((c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0)), (c0 ` c1)∈(0[[,]]1), ((c0 ` c1)∈ ℝ* ∧ 0[≤](c0 ` c1)∧(c0 ` c1)[≤]1))
  sylanbrc((c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0)), ((c0 ` c1)∈ ℝ* ∧ 0[≤](c0 ` c1)∧(c0 ` c1)[≤]1), ((c0 ` c1)∈ ℝ* ∧ 0[≤](c0 ` c1)), (c0 ` c1)[≤]1)
  sylib((c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0)), ((c0 ` c1)∈ ℝ* ∧ 0[≤](c0 ` c1)), (c0 ` c1)∈(0[[,]]+∞))
  sylan(c0 ∈ Prob, c1 ∈ dom(c0), (c0 ` c1)∈(0[[,]]+∞), c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)))
  measvxrge0(c0, dom(c0), c1)
  elxrge0((c0 ` c1))
  mpbid((c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0)), (c0 ` c1)[≤]1, (c0 ` c1)[≤](c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0)))
  measssd(c0, c1, ⋃ dom(c0), dom(c0), (c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0)))
  simpr(c0 ∈ Prob, c1 ∈ dom(c0))
  3syl((c0 ∈ Prob ∧ c1 ∈ dom(c0)), ⋃ dom(c0)∈ dom(c0), c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)), dom(c0)∈ ⋃ ran(sigAlgebra))
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prob, c1 ∈ dom(c0), c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)))
  domprobmeas(c0)
  measbase(c0, dom(c0))
  unielsiga(dom(c0))
  adantl(c0 ∈ Prob, c1 ∈ dom(c0), c1 ⊆ ⋃ dom(c0))
  elssuni(c1, dom(c0))
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prob, c1 ∈ dom(c0), ((c0 ` c1)[≤](c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0))↔(c0 ` c1)[≤]1))
  breq2d((c0 ` c1), cle, (c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0)), nat1, c0 ∈ Prob)
  probtot(c0)
  df-3an((c0 ` c1)∈ ℝ*, 0[≤](c0 ` c1), (c0 ` c1)[≤]1)
  mp2an(((c0 ` c1)∈(0[[,]]1)↔((c0 ` c1)∈ ℝ* ∧ 0[≤](c0 ` c1)∧(c0 ` c1)[≤]1)), 0 ∈ ℝ*, 1 ∈ ℝ*)
  0xr()
  1xr()
  elicc1(nat0, nat1, (c0 ` c1))
}

blocks.name: probnul
blocks.content: The probability of the empty event set is 0. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: unveldomd
blocks.content: The universe is an element of the domain of the probability, the universe (entire probability space) being ` U. dom P ` in our construction. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 22-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: unveldom
blocks.content: The universe is an element of the domain of the probability, the universe (entire probability space) being ` U. dom P ` in our construction. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 22-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: nuleldmp
blocks.content: The empty set is an element of the domain of the probability. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 22-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: probcun
blocks.content: The probability of the union of a countable disjoint set of events is the sum of their probabilities. (Third axiom of Kolmogorov) Here, the ` sum_ ` construct cannot be used as it can handle infinite indexing set only if they are subsets of ` ZZ ` , which is not the case here. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: probun
